channel.title: Pi 317 3 compiling errors

item.title: Pi 317 3 compiling errors
item.dc:creator: @pantherjr2 pantherjr2
item.description:
@pantherjr2 wrote:

src\server\model\players\skills\Woodcutting.java:83: error: no suitable method f ound for playerHasItem(int) if (c.getItems().playerHasItem(Axe_Settings[i][0]) || c. playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon] == Axe_Settings[i][0]) { ^ method ItemAssistant.playerHasItem(int,int) is not applicable (actual and formal argument lists differ in length) method ItemAssistant.playerHasItem(int,int,int) is not applicable (actual and formal argument lists differ in length) src\server\model\players\skills\Woodcutting.java:130: error: cannot find symbol c.getPA().addSkillXP(xp * Config.WOODCUT TING_EXPERIENCE, 8); ^ symbol: variable WOODCUTTING_EXPERIENCE location: class Config src\server\model\players\skills\Woodcutting.java:176: error: constructor Object in class Object cannot be applied to given types; new Object(i, x, y, 0, type, 10, j, respawnTime); ^ required: int,int,int,int,int,int,int,int,boolean found: int,int,int,int,int,int,int,int reason: actual and formal argument lists differ in length Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 3 errors Press any key to continue . . .

my woodcutting.java

[code]package server.model.players.skills;

import server.model.players.;
import server.Config;
import server.util.Misc;
import server.event.;
import server.model.objects.Object;

/**

  • @Author Null++
    */

public class Woodcutting {

private Client c;

public final int[][] Axe_Settings = {
	{1351, 1, 1, 879}, //Bronze
	{1349, 1, 2, 877}, //Iron
	{1353, 6, 3, 875}, //Steel
	{1361, 6, 4, 873}, //Black
	{1355, 21, 5, 871}, //Mithril
	{1357, 31, 6, 869}, //Addy
	{1359, 41, 7, 867}, //Rune
	{6739, 61, 8, 2846}, //Dragon
	{13661, 41, 8, 10251} //Adze
};

public final int[][] Tree_Settings = {
	{1276, 1342, 1, 25, 1511, 45, 100}, //Tree
	{1278, 1342, 1, 25, 1511, 45, 100}, //Tree
	{1286, 1342, 1, 25, 1511, 45, 100}, //Dead Tree
	{1281, 1356, 15, 38, 1521, 11, 20}, //Oak
	{1308, 7399, 30, 68, 1519, 11, 8}, //Willow
	{5552, 7399, 30, 68, 1519, 11, 8}, //Willow
	{1307, 1343, 45, 100, 1517, 48, 8}, //Maple
	{1309, 7402, 60, 175, 1515, 79, 5}, //Yew
	{1306, 7401, 75, 250, 1513, 150, 3}, //Magic
	{5551, 7399, 30, 68, 1519, 11, 8}, //Willow
	{5553, 7399, 30, 68, 1519, 11, 8} //Willow
};

int a = -1;

public Woodcutting(Client c) {
	this.c = c;
}

private boolean doingLoop = false;
private void loopWcAnim(final Client c, final int anim) {
	if(doingLoop)
		return;
	doingLoop = true;
	c.startAnimation(anim);
	CycleEventHandler.getSingleton().addEvent(c, new CycleEvent() {
		@Override
		public void execute(CycleEventContainer container) {
			if(!c.isWc) {
				container.stop();
			} else {
				c.startAnimation(anim);
			}
		}
		@Override
		public void stop() {
		}
	}, 3);
}

public void startWoodcutting(final int j, final int x, final int y, final int type) {
	if (c.isWc)
		return;
	if (c.wcing)
		return;
	int wcLevel = c.playerLevel[8];
	a = -1;
	c.turnPlayerTo(x, y);
	if (Tree_Settings[j][2] > wcLevel) {
		c.sendMessage("You need a Woodcutting level of " + Tree_Settings[j][2] + " to cut this tree.");
		return;
	}
	for (int i = 0; i < Axe_Settings.length; i++) {
		if (c.getItems().playerHasItem(Axe_Settings[i][0]) || c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon] == Axe_Settings[i][0]) {
			if (Axe_Settings[i][1] <= wcLevel) {
				a = i;
			}
		}
	}
	if (a == -1) {
		c.sendMessage("You need an axe to cut this tree.");
		return;
	}
	if (c.getItems().freeSlots() < 1) {
		c.sendMessage("You do not have enough inventory slots to do that.");
		return;
	}
	loopWcAnim(c, Axe_Settings[a][3]);
	c.isWc = true;
	c.treeX = x;
	c.treeY = y;
	c.wcing = true;
	CycleEventHandler.getSingleton().addEvent(c, new CycleEvent() {
		@Override
		public void execute(CycleEventContainer container) {
			if (!c.isWc) {
				container.stop();
				return;
			}
			if (c.isWc)
				c.startAnimation(Axe_Settings[a][3]);
			if (c.getItems().freeSlots() < 1) {
				c.sendMessage("You have ran out of inventory slots.");
				container.stop();
			}
			int xp = Tree_Settings[j][3];
			if (c.getItems().playerHasEquipped(10933)) {
				xp = (int)(xp * 1.002);
			}
			if (c.getItems().playerHasEquipped(10939)) {
				xp = (int)(xp * 1.008);
			}
			if (c.getItems().playerHasEquipped(10940)) {
				xp = (int)(xp * 1.006);
			}
			if (c.getItems().playerHasEquipped(10941)) {
				xp = (int)(xp * 1.004);
			}
			if (c.isWc) {
				c.getItems().addItem(Tree_Settings[j][4], 1);
				c.getPA().addSkillXP(xp * Config.WOODCUTTING_EXPERIENCE, 8);
			}
			if (c.getItems().freeSlots() < 1) {
				c.sendMessage("You have ran out of inventory slots.");
				container.stop();
			}
			if (c.isWc)
				birdNests();
			if (c.getItems().freeSlots() < 1) {
				c.sendMessage("You have ran out of inventory slots.");
				container.stop();
			}
			if (Misc.random(100) <= Tree_Settings[j][6]) {
				cutDownTree(Tree_Settings[j][5], x, y, type, Tree_Settings[j][1], Tree_Settings[j][0]);
				container.stop();
			}
		}
		@Override
		public void stop() {
			c.startAnimation(65535);
			c.isWc = false;
			c.treeX = 0;
			c.treeY = 0;
			c.wcing = false;
			doingLoop = false;
			return;
		}
	}, getTimer(j, a, wcLevel));
}

public int getTimer(int b, int c, int level) {
	double timer = (int)((Tree_Settings[b][2]  * 2) + 10 + Misc.random(20))-((Axe_Settings[c][2] * (Axe_Settings[c][2] * 0.75)) + level);
	if (timer < 3.0) {
		return 3;
	} else {
		return (int)timer;
	}
}

public void birdNests() {
	if (Misc.random(100) < 5) {
		c.getItems().addItem(5070, 1);
	}
}

public void cutDownTree(int respawnTime, int x, int y, int type, int i, int j) {
	new Object(i, x, y, 0, type, 10, j, respawnTime);
	for (int t = 0; t < PlayerHandler.players.length; t++) {
		if (PlayerHandler.players[t] != null) {
			if (PlayerHandler.players[t].treeX == x && PlayerHandler.players[t].treeY == y) {
				PlayerHandler.players[t].isWc = false;
				PlayerHandler.players[t].startAnimation(65535);
				PlayerHandler.players[t].treeX = 0;
				PlayerHandler.players[t].treeY = 0;
			}
		}
	}
}

}[/code]
any help would be appreciated.

Read full topic
